snippet: The indictment of a former professor who ran bogus courses for football players is the latest example of how collegiate sports are warping academic life.
abstract: Editorial holds indictment of former professor at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill who ran bogus courses for football players shows how revenue-rich intercollegiate athletics is warping academic life; points out NCAA should be alarmed at this scandal but shows no signs of dedicated reform.
lead_paragraph: The indictment of a former professor who ran bogus courses for football players is the latest example of how collegiate sports are warping academic life.

headline.main: Acing the Course at Chapel Hill
